name: The Honorable Ann M. Butchart
assigned: PA - Philadelphia County Court of Common Pleas
bio:
The Hon. Ann M. Butchart is a judge for the Philadelphia County Court of Common Pleas in Pennsylvania. She was elected to the bench in 2005, becoming the first openly gay person to be elected to office in Philadelphia.

Prior to her election, Butchart worked as a sole practitioner in her own private practice. She handled civil matters, specializing in Social Security Disability, personal bankruptcy, employee benefit claims, estate administration, and zoning for nonprofit community groups.

Butchart earned a B.A. from Rosemont College in 1973. She then completed a J.D. at Temple University James E. Beasley School of Law in 1993.

Her memberships have included the Philadelphia Lesbian and Gay Task Force, the Philadelphia Chapter of Dignity, and Gay and Lesbian Lawyers of Philadelphia. She has sat on the boards of the Liberty City Lesbian and Gay Democratic Club and the William Way LGBT Community Center.
education: Temple University James E. Beasley School of Law  Degree: J.D.  Year:1993
press: Mazzoni Center Legal Services Honors Two Trailblazing Philadelphia Judges
